DOC.HEADLINE: FIRE BURNS 200 ACRES NEAR LEBEC
DOC.TEXT: A disabled car that caught_fire beside the Golden State Freeway just north of the Los Angeles County_line set_off a brush_fire Thursday that leaped the eight-lane roadway and burned across steep hillsides near Los Padres National Forest , authorities said . Within three hours of starting at 1:45 p.m. , the flames had destroyed nearly 200 acres in the Tejon Pass as nearly 500 firefighters fought the blaze , said Deputy Chief Steve Gage of the Kern County Fire_Department . Firefighters from Kern , Ventura , Los Angeles , Riverside and San Bernardino counties were aided by helicopters and air tankers , Gage said . The fire was almost directly across from Fort Tejon State Park , about half a mile north of the town of Lebec , Gage said . The blaze came_close to a school , but had damaged no structures by late Thursday . Using bulldozers and hand crews , firefighters dug a fire line in an effort to contain the fire to about 700 acres , Gage said . " We hope to have it contained by midnight , " he said . " We just hope the fire line holds. "
